column4: Does anyone know of an app that I can use to detect and remove duplicate files? Currently I use fdupes to make a list and remove them by hand.
how does fdupes work? depending on the format of the list, you can probably use the program xargs to remove the files in the list in one swipe
fdupes creates a list with 1 file name on each line. So it takes 2 lines and lists both the file names with the same hash.
would you mind pastebinning a few lines? i might be able to whip up a command for you
wow, pastebin is *crawling*. i'll get back to you when it finally loads
okay, so like you said, each pair of lines is the same file? what does it do if you have three copies of the same file?
I'm not sure but I'll try
okay. it's fairly simple to write something that will just delete every other file listed, but I want to make sure that won't have any strange side effects :)
I tried making blank text files then 2 files with that had the number 1 inside so they'd have a different MD5. I found that it creates a blank line in between groups of files.
ooh, that makes it tougher :) just a moment
hm. i can't think of a way to do this in just a few lines, which would mean i'd hesitate to let someone else run it on data they care about :( sorry
but if you can find someone who knows awk, they could probably do it. i'm just bad at awk :)
I didn't find a visual program but I've been testing a script from here: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=647883 (For duplicate files) and so far it works.
thanks for all of your help :) I really should learn python next...
I've been meaning to do that, too. just never have the time...
